website_summaries.verdict: Great starter kit for newbies or those looking for more power than the MiniMite. Suits hobbyists/crafters; rpm are steady, but tool struggles to cut tougher materials.
pros: EZ Twist Nose Cap allows wrench-free accessory attachment
Corded tool provides solid, consistent power and good detail work
Can be used for hobbies, crafts, and precision nail trimming on pets
cons: Veteran users are disappointed w/updated carrying case w/no space for accessories
Complaints about having to buy a separate chuck
Multiple collet sizes may be required to accommodate accessories
Tool heats up with heavy use

customer_reviews.title: ZERO of the included accessories will work with this Dremel without additional purchases.
customer_reviews.text: I’d love to tel you if this Dremel works well or not. See, I made the assumption that, since the kit came with a number of accessory tips for grinding/sanding/drilling/etc., that the included Dremel would be able to use them. Wrong! Evidently you need different sized “collets” to attach the different tools: Part numbers 480-483. This Dremel kit only includes the smallest collet — which ZERO of the included accessories use. So if I want to use this today, I’ll need to make a trip to Lowe’s or Walmart, or order yet again on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Failure
customer_reviews.text: I have been using dremel tools for years. I recently purchased this dremel and I am highly dissatisfied. I finally had to use it for the first time and it doesn't work. It cuts in and out when it wants only in the 10th speed. I'm more than aggravated. I switched plugs thinking maybe I have a bad outlet but this problem persists. For this reason and my now big waste of money I give it one star. Be weary about buying this item.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great tool that lasts for years.  Unmatched versatility.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one as a gift because I have had one for over 4 years. Use this thing a ton, and have never had an issue. The versatility of the tool, and the abundance of attachments and tips is in matched by any of the other rotary tools out there. Dremel has been in the market for many years and in my opinion, is the standard against which all others should be compared. Get ya one and... get creative.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Very Good for Polishing Silver
customer_reviews.text: Over the years my wife and I have accumulated a great deal of Sterling Silver (trays, candlesticks, a tea service, Jewish ritual objects, etc., which we put into storage for almost a year after relocating from Long Island to Florida, and rebuilding a condo to our specifications. When we unpacked the silver, most pieces were virtually black, and almost impossible to polish by hand. I bought the Dremel tool and various polishing attachments, and managed to get almost everything gleaming in just one afternoon's work. The multispeed feature of this particular model was especially useful. I haven't used the tool for other things, but I can wholeheartedly recommend it for polishing silver and other metal objects.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my old dremel that finally died after 15+ years of service. This is horrible. When it came in, I took it out of the box and packed in my tool chest. When I finally needed to use it, I was very disappointed. It had nowhere near the power or speed of my old dremel. I think it is defective, but it's been a few months and I didn't keep the box so I can't return it. I have a little cordless dremel that outperforms this unit. I'm not one to bash products, but this was a real disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: BRShooter

customer_reviews.title: I like the new features
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a Dremmel tool I've had for 30 years. I like the new features, especially the built in chuck key. The new models are substantially more bulky than my old one but fit the hand well. The only reson i did not give a 5 star rating is the variable speed button has a little slop or play when you move it, especially on the first two speeds. Since I only use it occasionally, that isn't too much of a bother. There are other brands out there but I stuick with Dremmel becuase of the durability of the tool. My 30 year old model (no variable speed) still is going strong. Case and accessories are good.
customer_reviews.author: Gerball

customer_reviews.title: Not right.
customer_reviews.text: Just started using this after a year. Bought as it was a decent deal. Issue is the lock button and loosening the attachments. The lock button pushed down, using the small wrench to loosen does not work. It seems stripped. So now I have a useless tool. Anyone else experience this? Can I get a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Hutchy

customer_reviews.title: Legit dremel products mean quality.
customer_reviews.text: A very well timed purchase of this product on prime day. I was in the market for a dremel, and had shopped around local hardware stores and appliance giants and found this same kit upwards of $100.00, where as i picked up this one for a measly 50! thats 50 percent off, Kyle! it comes with a 1.5" shield attachment and a few other basics. i think 23 options in total. it is also variable speed which is important to work with soft metals.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny_Honest

customer_reviews.title: Very good first rotary tool, and will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my girlfriend's sister, who just turned 16, I figured it would be a good first power tool. She quickly destroyed it by pushing in the Chuck lock while the Dremel was running I got her a new one for Christmas, as they're not terribly expensive to replace. The Dremel 3000 is a really great option as a first rotary tool, and this particular kit is a really solid selection of bits. The variable speed is very important, and this doesn't have such a range that you get confused. Keep in mind aswell, of your tool breaks prematurely, Dremel will repair it if you send it in, for free.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Dremel has really skimped on quality... The chuck lock is made of super weak plastic and broke about the third time I used it. $60 piece of trash after that.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Swain

customer_reviews.title: Great for our dogs nails! It's a low enough speed that it doesn't bother them
customer_reviews.text: We trim two dogs nails every time they get a haircut and this is the Dremel to get. It's variable speed, comes with the wrench of you need to change the pads (which is fairly simple to do, even if the dogs are up on the grooming table). We purchased it with a warranty because quite a few people mentioned they fail after a year or so. After a year and a half (20-30 uses), it's held up well and saved us money because we didn't have to take them in
customer_reviews.author: Ben P.

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: I love all dremel products, in the past i had some issues with certain products dremel make but i have come to understand alot about these smaller tools, they serve their porpuse as a small rotery tool and can even get some larger jobs done with the right aproach, basically i think knowing your tools and their application is most important when scoping any job, overall this dremel is a fantastic tool and i will continue to buy them
customer_reviews.author: Straight

customer_reviews.title: Barnd new Dremel will not turn on.
customer_reviews.text: I unboxed my new Dremel 3000 from Prime day and the piece of junk will not even turn on. Stay away. I think one star is too many when the product arrives broken.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: New Dremel!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Christmas. I was quite upset when I opened it, plugged it in, and...IT DIDNT WORK!!! But do not dispare! I called the company support line (provide with my order) and spoke to a woman that talked my through a minor tweak. Seems that taking out the brushes, using the supplied tool and reversing them fixed the issue. All is right in the world. My faith in humanity is restored. Thank you Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had an older 1 speed Dremel I used for years. I still have the older model haven't used it in a while but decided I needed something with more control over speed and accessories and this model is proving to be much more versitile I am quite happy with it thus far. I want to start my grandson using the older model and if he likes using it I will buy him an updated "kit".
customer_reviews.author: Mema

customer_reviews.title: Necessary Tool
customer_reviews.text: Every tool chest needs a Dremel. I purchased this as an impulse buy and ended up needing it within a week. I do not use most of the included bits for fine wood crafting, opting instead for a side cutting bit for metal work. I was able to rework some of the door hinges and catches in our home to greatly improve their operation in a very cost effective manner.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: It works, but.......
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price but you get what you pay for here. If at all possible, spend a little extra and get a better tool. Don't get me wrong, it does work, and if you don't really plan on using it much and don't need a serious tool to get the job done, buy it. It's good to keep in that miscellaneous drawer filled with handy things. But if you are serious about your tools, spend a little more.
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Baracus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: First time ever using one but every time I have used it I have been happy with it! I bought with the goal of using to edge my leather pieces and it has worked so far! Perfect size and love that it has several speeds to pick from! Easy to remove and attach different wheels too but the instructions could be a little better. So far I have been very happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for managed distressing on the edges of painted furniture.
customer_reviews.text: I had the 4000 before but burned the motor out on that one after having it for 3 years (in fairness I used the crap our other it) I decided to get this one in place of the 4000 model because i wanted a lighter weight tool. I use it for doing finite distressing on chair legs that I reupholster. And some minor distressing on antique tables I paint. It works well, the speed control setting is helpful, it just gets heavy on the hand after using for a couple of hours.
customer_reviews.author: Loretto E.

customer_reviews.title: ALL accessories included fit fine
customer_reviews.text: All accessories fit the tool just fine. Some buyers don’t know how to use a dremel and write reviews that honestly, show how clueless they are. This tool is fine and works as designed. I’m satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: While this tool came with everything it said it would, there were some issues. Several of the speed settings didn't change the speed at all, and the fiberglass cutting discs came with holes that were to small to mount on the small screw mandrel. I don't recall having any of these issues with my previous Dremel tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dremel 3000-1/24 is great tool for many home projects.
customer_reviews.text: Bought myself a new tool and have great hobby task performance on multiple projects including some home repair. Had a manicure version that ran on AAA batteries and find this cord model more consistent with wood and other materials. Also having fun purchasing just what I need in terms of blades for new projects but the basic set that came with this model was a great start for many projects.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Phillips

customer_reviews.title: good tool
customer_reviews.text: the only thing i would like to see, the tool come with a stand for adding a flex shaft or hang the tool instead of laying it on the counter I use this on leather projects so I like the low variable speed so it won't burn the leather with using a flex shaft.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Did not come with collets required to use attachments.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. I can't review the item based upon it's performance because the item did not come with the collets required to use the attachments (the attachments are too large to fit). I just ordered some collets, and hopefully they'll work with the item. Edit: collets came in, and I it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: John Merrick

customer_reviews.title: Medium Quality
customer_reviews.text: It seems well made except for the variable speed switch which is a little sensitive and jumps around the rpms a little unpredictably. Made in Mexico.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and well built.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our son. He likes to modify and build his own foam dart blasters (nerf guns). The variable speed is great for some one who is a little nervous about a tool being too powerful. He has used it every day since he got it.
customer_reviews.author: grfx

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this Dremel! I am a 50 year old female, without much skill or knowledge with wood work.Long story short I used this dremel for cutting 1" wood trim after the guy that laid my laminate flooring, did a terrible job with our trim.The cutting wheel worked PERFECTLY and the adjustable speed really came in handy.NOW looking for the next project to use this sweet little tool for:)
customer_reviews.author: Virginia C.

customer_reviews.title: Best dremel for RC hobbyist
customer_reviews.text: Best dremel for RC hobbyist. I first bought a cordless one and I regretted so much. this one has plenty power and it is go-to tool. I use it to cut carbon fiber, screws, make body holes and they can do everything. I bought a dremel tip package they sell on amazon and it is a beast for home RC hobbyist. Strongly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: 곰돌이

customer_reviews.title: Great selection of bits
customer_reviews.text: I had to watch a video to figure out how to change the bit the first time, but now that I know how to do it it is really easy. I love that this came with a great selection of bits. It is also quieter than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Ann

customer_reviews.title: Mindless, utterly useless kit bundle
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of the purchasers that did not receive ANY collets that fit the tools that came with the kit and the single collet that came with the motor didn't fit any of the tools. This is either stupidity on the part of the kit bundler or outright duplicity to make you pay more. I had three choices: (1) Return the kit for full refund. (2) Buy the collet kit winding up with an extra collet and an extra nut. (3) Buy the chuck. I chose the last option. Why didn't I call "service"? Because I can't abide phone tag and avoid phones like my life depended on it, which it does because they're so incredibly stressful.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Paris

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Price
customer_reviews.text: WE've wanted a dremel for a long while, so getting this one with all the tools and sharpeners was a answer to a prayer. If it was used, we couldnt tell, it looked new to us! Thanks for offering it up!
customer_reviews.author: Pcful

customer_reviews.title: Takes care of tiny tasks
customer_reviews.text: Review for: Dremel 3000-1/25 Variable Speed Rotary This is very nice, works well, does quite a lot, makes small/tiny almost impossible jobs doable, glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: noreallee

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy again
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure if I would buy this or the 4000. I’ve used it several times customizing Glock frames. I have more than enough speed and power. I attached a smaller handle adapter and it powered it fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Malone

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: I opted for a higher end unit but it vibrates more than my old Dremel which was bottom of the line years ago when I bought it. It will do but I thought it would be an upgrade and its not.
customer_reviews.author: TPF

customer_reviews.title: Critical tool for any shop
customer_reviews.text: I use this is many ways throughout my shop. I work with wood mostly, but I've used this to cut small pieces of metal and brush some rusty bolts clean. This really is a versatile multi tool that everyone should have.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Labriola

customer_reviews.title: ... replace the many pet brand grinders and am extremely happy with this product - it is so much quieter ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the many pet brand grinders and am extremely happy with this product - it is so much quieter and powerful, I get the pet nails of my boxer and mastiff done in half the time!
customer_reviews.author: Tammie

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool and good price
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool and good price. I have an old unit that wore out and was used with a holding fixture like a drill press which this new unit would not fit into. I ended up buying a new work station so we are in operation again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Son

customer_reviews.title: Extremely versatile power tool
customer_reviews.text: The dremel tools are just fantastic for small areas or detail work. Loads of available attachments available. This took allows you to get into small areas that other tools just can't access. Good for so many jobs it should be in everyone's repair tools.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D.

customer_reviews.title: Needs additional collets to connect all accessories
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace another rotary tool that had finally ceased operating. The Dremel seems to be working OK. Fortunately, I still had the collets from the previous rotary tool so I could use all my accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: You will need to purchase additional attachments in order to use it...
customer_reviews.text: Where are the collets? I didn’t know I would need different sizes, so it didn’t occur to me to check through the description. I’m up against a deadline and needed to be able to use true tool straight out of the box, but NONE of the attachments for without additional equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I am a crafter and this is perfect for my uses. Plenty of power, love the shield as I cut brass rod for sign lettering. Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: mth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tools, great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Dremel is an awesome tool/product/company. Bought my daughter this 3000 tool and one of the parts was damaged in shipping. Dremel not only send us a replacement part, but they sent 3 to make up for the inconvenience. They went above and beyond to help us out and it didn't go un-noticed. Excellent quality, perfect selection of accessories for my daughter in her wood working endeavors and we will definitely buy Dremel tools again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing life span.
customer_reviews.text: Only used for a few projects and the low to mid range speed adjustment cuts in and out. And the vibration has noticeably increased after only light use. I’ve owned 3 different models of dremel and this one I was expecting more from... disappointing
customer_reviews.author: nicholas romano

customer_reviews.title: Acrylic Nails.
customer_reviews.text: I use on acrylic nails with the hand extender and keyless chuck. The cord is quite thick which makes it less maneuverable. That is my only problem.
customer_reviews.author: BMC

customer_reviews.title: Good tool but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I go through these tools very often. My complaint is there really is no good competitor. They're locking button is weak and they do not last very long.
customer_reviews.author: John Gero

customer_reviews.title: Quit Working in Less Than 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: Quit without warning less than 3 months after receiving. Very disappointed! My last Stengel lasted over 12 years.
customer_reviews.author: GES

customer_reviews.title: Locking function stripped with minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Locking button stripped out within just a few changes of bits. Terrible design and I did not overtighten it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I use my dremel every day.
customer_reviews.text: I am an artist and I use my dremel tool everyday. I had an old one that lasted for so long. This new one seems great, but I have only had it for a month so I will see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Honeybee

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: I have had and used a Dremel for many years. It is the perfect tool for sanding, cutting, grinding, drilling, buffing and many other applications for small, light projects.
customer_reviews.author: J. SIMPRINI

customer_reviews.title: Great for home projects
customer_reviews.text: My family absolutely loves this product. I have bought 3. My son especially loves it. He had been borrowing his mother-in-laws for different projects. I ordered him one for his birthday. He’s very hard to please and loves having his own.
customer_reviews.author: charlotte rushing

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself
customer_reviews.text: Very good set. My old one finally wore out and I replaced it with this one. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Badders

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great for small projects. If you really like sparks the wheels are really fun to use but unfortunately a hack saw is faster. But you might run into something where a hack saw might not fit or it is uncomfortable. The tool itself is really fast and nice.
customer_reviews.author: David Frederick

customer_reviews.title: It's a Dremel!
customer_reviews.text: I'm still getting used to it after many years of using my older models. I mostly like it better than the old ones, but can't use many accessories from my older units. I wish it was a bit slimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Boy

customer_reviews.title: Dremel
customer_reviews.text: Very nice dremel tool. The only issue with it that the various dremel heads gets worn pretty fast, so I would recommend buyig extra heads if you have some good volume work to do with the dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Edi V

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Works like you would expect. Don’t get a cheap harbor freight one like I did and waste time and money. Pony up and get an actual dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Radius Racing

customer_reviews.title: Buy nice not twice
customer_reviews.text: Started with a cheap Chinese knockoff, can't possibly compare in quality. Buy the good stuff the first time around.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Comes with plenty of attachments. Easy to use. Multi-functional with every function working to perfection. You really do get a lot with this wonderful product. I have been using it to polish metals and I LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great dremel I love that it is not cordless so ...
customer_reviews.text: Great dremel I love that it is not cordless so I don't have to worry about any power issues. Tons of addons for these make them a must have. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: I wish I would have picked the better model. The bearings in this model do not ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have picked the better model. The bearings in this model do not run true. You have to put the bit all the way in or it runs out of round so bad as to make it useable.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Gilliland

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model to specifically be used on a small desk drill press and works terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Very nice basic set.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use in working on guitars and basses. It's been a valuable tool for several modifications.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Its a Dremel!
customer_reviews.text: Its a dremel. a bit expensive but it does what its supposed to do
customer_reviews.author: sehai741

customer_reviews.title: Great product well made and price
customer_reviews.text: Loved this item for quality price and attachments would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Casamento

customer_reviews.title: Fives
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mostly for gunsmithing on my Saiga 12 shotgun to remove the rear tang so I could add an internal receiver block. It passed the test and cut through that Russian steel like butter with the EZ406-02 1 1/2-Inch EZ Lock Rotary Tool Cut-Off Wheel. No noticeable drag or loss in RPM, I imagine this tool will last longer than me. So glad I didn't buy a cordless model.
customer_reviews.author: DVD

customer_reviews.title: Great for gun cleaning/polishing
customer_reviews.text: Works great when polishing barrel ramps and crowns. The speed is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Attachment adaptor not included.
customer_reviews.text: Dremel works well but I was disappointed to find that some of the attachments included couldn't be used because I didn't have the right size chuck nut. Apparently you have to buy the different size chucks separately in order to use all attachments included. Seems like a scam to me that they give you attachments that you have to spend more money on in order to use.
customer_reviews.author: Xenomorphs

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool I've always wanted one but never could afford it
customer_reviews.text: Got this during a prime day sale for a great price and sings be great little tool
customer_reviews.author: LDHURST33

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, use it on almost everything every chance i get.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this for light hobby work. Great tool for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L.

customer_reviews.title: Adequate unit.
customer_reviews.text: Attachments are a little light. Variable speed is really nice but motor doesn't have much torque at low speed so you have to crank it up more than originally intended.
customer_reviews.author: Hopper

customer_reviews.title: I had the battery powered Dremel tool for several years ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the battery powered Dremel tool for several years. When it quit, I bought this corded version. This model is much more powerful than the cordless. The Dremel tool is one item I would never be without. It has bailed me out so many times, I have lost count. There are certain things you can do with the Dremel, that you just cannot do with anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Price

customer_reviews.title: Get a decent accessory pack and have fun.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to use and stays cool even with long projects. Less vibration than my old Dremel tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice dremel.
customer_reviews.text: Nice replacement for my really old Dremel that died. It has served me for over a year now with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Right tool for the right job.
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what I needed it to do (cut down a PVC pipe coming out of the floor). Nice to have the right tool for the right job - makes a huge difference. Looking forward to doing more with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dsmcclin

customer_reviews.title: It’s good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use for the small cutting and sanding I do with a Dremel. This unit replaced my previous one that broke after 9 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Plain jane good ole' variable speed Dremel tool
customer_reviews.text: It's a variable speed Dremel tool. That is why I bought it, and it is what I expected, Nothing less, nothing more.
customer_reviews.author: Franz

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs a dremel.
customer_reviews.text: What’s not to like. Everyone needs a dermel. Nice tool, nice case, good attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: If you do any kind of hobby or craft work, you need one of these . . .
customer_reviews.text: . . .and not a knock off. If you want to use any of the fine dremel accessories, you need a dremel as the collar size on things like the drill stand or router seems to be propritary. The bits are just fine though, those seem to be somewhat universal.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: great dremel
customer_reviews.text: love this dremel.. Glad I got it... has a variety of speeds which helps when working with small things.....I would buy again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. He's a sculpture and was absolutely elated when he received this for Christmas.He's had his old Dremel since he was 14.Really looking forward to using this!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Albertson

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The dremmel worked fine however when I tried to change out the bit the locking mechanism that allows you to remove the bit would not hold in place. I just kept turning so I can't change the bit.
customer_reviews.author: jack tatum

customer_reviews.title: Instructions?
customer_reviews.text: Apparently, you need to already be familiar with Dremels to use this. The instructions are inadequate.
customer_reviews.author: GypsyJen

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend and he is OBSESSED WITH IT! He is continually thinking of the next project he can do with his dremel. I will soon have to hide everything dremelable in our house! Really nice and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Latine

customer_reviews.title: good to have one
customer_reviews.text: it's easy for me to do any job, and less space on my workstation

customer_reviews.title: it's a work of art and brilliant in its function

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my fiancé this for his birthday. He works with metal and wood. He loves how versatile it is, and how easy it is to use. Being 12V it has much more power than a battery powered dremel. He has already used it over the last few weeks for many projects. Awesome purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Summer farrand

customer_reviews.title: Love the Drill, not so thrilled about the case design
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Dremel. I bought it to replace a very old one I had that finally burned out. My only complaint would be that the old one had a better case (unfortunately the new one will not fit in this old case). The old case had holes for the different drill bits/attachments to fit in and made it easy to see and find the accessory you wanted. The new one only has a cheap plastic box inside of the case that you have to put your accessories in and they kind of get piled on top of one another. So a good improvement to the Dremel itself, but not so much the interior case design.
customer_reviews.author: JIR

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Along with the accessory kit I purchased, this versatile tool is a welcome addition to my equipment.

product_meta.title: Dremel 3000-1/25 Variable Speed Rotary Tool Kit- 1 Attachment and 25 Accessories- Grinder, Mini Sander, Polisher, Router, and Engraver- Perfect for Routing, Metal Cutting, Wood Carving, and Polishing
product_meta.description: Style:26 Piece KitThe Dremel 3000 is the result of upgrading our most popular rotary tool using user-requested features to improve the tool's design and ergonomics. The tool also features the EZ Twist nose cap with an integrated wrench that allows the nose cap to be used as a wrench to tighten accessories and eliminates the need for a separate wrench. A more efficient fan design and side vents provide a cooler running tool making it comfortable for extended periods of use. The tool also features a symmetrical design including a trumpet-shaped nose cap to facilitate a pencil-grip tool hold. The ability to use all existing Dremel rotary tool accessories and most attachments let the 3000 complete a wide range of applications including cutting, grinding, sanding, carving and polishing a variety of materials. The Dremel 3000-1/25 Rotary Tool Kit includes: 1 Attachments, 25 Accessories, and a rugged storage/carrying case.
feature_bullets: VERSATILE ROTARY TOOL KIT: includes Dremel 3000 corded rotary tool, 1 attachments, 25 high-quality Dremel accessories, plastic storage case, and accessory case.
HIGH PERFORMANCE 1.2AMP MOTOR – Provides maximum power and performance at all speeds.
6 VARIABLE SPEEDS provide greater control and maximum accessory versatility and precise tool control (5,000 – 35,000 RPM)
INNOVATED AIR FLOW SYSTEM- ventilation mechanism helps prevent heat build-up for smoother, cooler, and quieter operation
SLIM & ERGONOMIC BODY – 360-degree grip zone for added comfort & grip during extended use.
25 VERSATILE ACCESSORIES INCLUDED: Ideal for DIY or crafting projects like detail sanding, sharpening, grinding, cutting, carving, variable speed polishing, and cleaning
2 YEAR TOOL WARRANTY & USA-BASED CUSTOMER SERVICE – Available by chat, email, phone or visit us at our service center in Racine, WI.
